props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- Play resolves the request using the routes file, which maps URIs to controller action methods.
- The action method renders the page, using Twirl templates.

1) Create a page - hello.scala.html
@(name: String)
@main("Hello") {
    <section id="top">
        <div class="wrapper">
            <h1>Hello, @name</h1>
        </div>
    </section>
}

2) Create a controller with action method
@Singleton
class HomeController @Inject()(cc: ControllerComponents) extends AbstractController(cc) {
   def hello(name: String) = Action {
     Ok(views.html.hello(name))
   }
}

3) Define a route in conf/routes
GET  /hello        controllers.HomeController.hello(name: String)

props.toolTipText:
app                      → Application sources
 └ assets                → Compiled asset sources
    └ stylesheets        → Typically LESS CSS sources
    └ javascripts        → Typically CoffeeScript sources
 └ controllers           → Application controllers
 └ models                → Application business layer
 └ views                 → Templates
build.sbt                → Application build script
conf                     → Configurations files  (on classpath)
 └ application.conf      → Main configuration file
 └ routes                → Routes definition
dist                     → Arbitrary files to be included in your projects distribution
public                   → Public assets
 └ stylesheets           → CSS files
 └ javascripts           → Javascript files
 └ images                → Image files
project                  → sbt configuration files
 └ build.properties      → Marker for sbt project
 └ plugins.sbt           → sbt plugins including the declaration for Play itself

- we can disable this Play layout and use default SBT layout by
// Use sbt default layout
  .disablePlugins(PlayLayoutPlugin)

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- Play is Scala web application framework
- It is based on light weight, stateless, and web friendly architecture
- For highly scalable applications thanks to its reactive model based on Pekko streams
- Pekko, endows Play applications with a stateless, non-blocking, event-driven architecture 
  that provides horizontal and vertical scalability and uses resources more efficiently.
- It provides concise and functional programming patterns
- as full stack framework, it includes all components required for web application 
- It is known and loved for, such as auto-reloading, clear error messages, and template compilation
- It uses Twirl templates, to render pages

Features
- Integrated HTTP server
- Form handling
- CSRF protection
- powerful routing mechanism
- I18n support
- hot reloading
- integrations with many ORM layers (JPA, NoSQL, etc...)

Requirements
- Java
- SBT
